This is genuinely the only game that I would say is "Perfect".

There are absolutely 0 flaws with it, no matter how hard I tried to break it, it stayed sturdy.

The story-mode is a masterpiece, and proves that video games are an art-form. Every single line was incredible, the twist villain actually felt shocking. Cara Mia Addio made me sob like a baby. Cave Johnson is Cave Johnson. Ohhhh, but the best part. It's definitely GlaDOs. She makes this game have so much charm.

Not to mention the puzzles! OH, THEY'RE GREAT!

Overall, Portal 2 is a 10/10, and is my 2nd favorite game of all time.
If you liked the first one, this one is better in every aspect.
Тут можно в кооперативе разными способами убить недруга, мне нравится!

A massive step up from Portal. Just about everything I disliked about the og Portal is fixed in this game and then even more. Dialogue in this game is incredibly funny and always kept me entertained. Once again, portal mechanic is unique, and more refined in this game. Twist is less predictable and final fight is much more fun. The gel mechanics are fun as well. My gripes for this game is that it's a bit too hard in my opinion. I've never really been amazing at puzzle games but I was turning to a walkthrough for much of this game, especially in chapters 6-8 (making them kinda slow for me), which is a problem og Portal didn't really have, at least to this degree. I also wish it had a happy ending. Even if it made more naritive sense for it to be unhappy, I wish it was happy after the connections between GLaDOS and Chell. One extra thing is that the ending song is really fun and inanely catchy, i've had it stuck in my head for 3 days since I beat the game. Overall the game is a blast and would highly recommend, even if you haven't played Portal. 9/10 Really wish VALVe still made games, they put out some bangers in their time.

Edit: After coming back to the game, I realize there is so much more to it than that. The modding capabilities make it replayable to no end. With some mods, such as Portal RELOADED (which I am currently playing) its like getting a Portal 3 and is an amazing experience. Bumping my score up to 10/10

Yep, you read how long I have played it- 1000+ hours. It goes without saying that this is truly the best puzzle game to ever exist. It is already 11 years old but it is just as fun as the day it was released. I lived the original Portal game- but somehow they managed to make it even better. The only other puzzle game that really comes even close to Portal 2 is Antichamber. Although Antichamber requires more outside of the box thinking, it has almost no story and has over simplistic graphics. However in Portal 2, the story is the best I have seen in a video game in a long time and the developers made the game have amazing graphics- not to mention it can can run on almost any computer. But really, what I like about Portal 2 the most, is the ability to create your own tests and share it with the community. All in all, to sum it up- amazing story line, amazing graphics, good puzzles, and allows creativity from the community. 100% recommend. If you haven't tried it yet, try it now. It is worth the full price.

Played this in 2011+2012, forgot to write a review. Well, it's easily recommended since it's one of the best games ever made. I suggest anyone to give it a go, unless you absolutely loathe puzzle games. 

Great voice acting, great writing, great humour, great level design, great mechanics, great puzzles. Around 8-20 hrs for Single player, depending on your solving skills and whether you go for all the achievements or not. On top of that, a very compelling Co-op mode with super fun 2-player challenges. 

It goes on sale regularly, so definitely check out for that. The game still holds up great a decade+ later.
